text: Pagurus pollicaris is a hermit crab commonly found along the Atlantic coast of North America from New Brunswick to the Gulf of Mexico. It is known by a number of common names, including gray hermit crab, flat-clawed hermit crab, flatclaw hermit crab, shield hermit crab, thumb-clawed hermit crab, broad- clawed hermit crab, and warty hermit crab. P. pollicaris inhabits the shells of shark eye snails and whelks. It grows to a length of and a width of . The shell is often shared by the commensal zebra flatworm (Stylochus ellipticus). The diet of the flat-clawed hermit crab comprises organic matter, algae, and sometimes other hermit crabs. Fish are the most important predators of this species. ==References== Category:Hermit crabs Category:Crustaceans of the Atlantic Ocean Category:Crustaceans described in 1817
title: Pagurus pollicaris
